Kent County Juvenile Detention Center
1501 Cedar, NE
Grand Rapids, MI 49503-1390
Dear Mr. Vogel:
This letter is a follow-up to the Departmentâ€™s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 08/10/2022. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
Your facility was found to be in compliance with the requirements of Licensing Rules for
Juvenile Court Operated Facilities.
An onsite tour was completed on 08/10/2022. The facility was observed to be clean and well
maintained. Ample staff were present and observed to be supervising the residents. This
consultant viewed all the pod areas where the youth are residing, and it was observed to be
clean and well maintained. Residents were attending their onsite schooling during the tour.
During interviews staff reported feeling both staff and residents are safe at the facility and
supervision is provided as required. When interviewing staff, they reported they have been
trained to have youth out of their rooms as much as possible and restraints are a last resort
tool when a youth is escalated. They were able to explain to this consultant about the verbal
de-escalation skills they have learned and techniques to not get into power struggles with
youth. One area of growth staff gave feedback on was for leadership to continue to hire
more staff for extra support due to the increased number of youth entering the facility. Youth
reported they feel safe at the facility, and they report feeling respected by staff. They
reported staff only use their trained restraint model when all other de- escalation skills have
failed, and they do not automatically put their hands on a youth. An area of growth youth
suggested was staff consistency with expectations. The youth explained there has been
newer staff coming to work at the facility that there is not always the same consistency of
expectations.

Consultation was provided to the administration team about the feedback from the staff
interviews. It was reported the facility is still in the process of hiring more staff for extra
support on the units. Consultation was provided about the increased number of seclusions.
Administration reported over the pass year there has been an increased number of
residents coming into the facility and some have increased mental health and behavioral
concerns. Administration reported they continue to review the number of seclusions and
restraints and talk with staff about different techniques to use with the youth. It was also
reported some youth have been choosing to take time away in their rooms per their own
request and the facility has to note that as a seclusion.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to
speak to someone immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel
at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
August 15, 2022
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
August 15, 2022
Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager
